item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Anieli, post:19, topic:410147”]But none of the others have that and they work fine? :S why would this one be different?[/quote]What do you mean none of the others have that and they work fine? Let me break this down for you.
Here is the method i’m talking about. Your other issue has to do with your inFightCaves boolean.

This method is a boolean and only returns true under certain conditions. Lets say your player is in jail so c.Jail is true.

[code=java]public boolean teleTabTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType){
if(c.Jail == true){//if the player is in jail send message You cant teleport out of jail!
//Now the message is sent but nothing is gonna stop the player from teleporting out of jail with the tele TAB.
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of Jail!”);

    } else if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) {
            c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!");
    } else if(c.duelStatus == 5){
            c.sendMessage("You can't teleport during a duel!");
    } else if(c.inFightCaves()) {
            c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!");
    } else if(c.inGameTest()) {
            c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame.");
    } else if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL){
            c.sendMessage("You can't teleport above level "+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+" in the wilderness.");
    } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength){
            c.sendMessage("You are teleblocked and can't teleport.");
    } else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){
            if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0)
                    c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
            c.stopMovement();
            removeAllWindows();                        
            c.teleX = x;
            c.teleY = y;
            c.npcIndex = 0;
            c.playerIndex = 0;
            c.faceUpdate(0);
            c.teleHeight = height;
            if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("teleTab")) {
                    c.startAnimation(9597);
                    c.teleEndAnimation = 11973;
                    c.teleTimer = 8;
                    c.gfx0(1680);
            }
            return true;
    }
    return false;

}[/code]

This method will always allow the player to teleport as long as these conditions are met.

else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){
The only time the player cant use a teletab is if they just respawned, is dead or just teled.
For all the if statements and the sendMessages to mean anything your teleTabTeleport method needs to look like this.

public boolean teleTabTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType){
        if(c.Jail == true){
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!");
                return false;
        } else if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) {
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!");
                return false;
        } else if(c.duelStatus == 5){
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport during a duel!");
                return false;
        } else if(c.inFightCaves()) {
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!");
                return false;
        } else if(c.inGameTest()) {
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame.");
                return false;
        } else if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL){
                c.sendMessage("You can't teleport above level "+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+" in the wilderness.");
                return false;
        } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength){
                c.sendMessage("You are teleblocked and can't teleport.");
                return false;
        } else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){
                if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0)
                        c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
                c.stopMovement();
                removeAllWindows();                        
                c.teleX = x;
                c.teleY = y;
                c.npcIndex = 0;
                c.playerIndex = 0;
                c.faceUpdate(0);
                c.teleHeight = height;
                if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("teleTab")) {
                        c.startAnimation(9597);
                        c.teleEndAnimation = 11973;
                        c.teleTimer = 8;
                        c.gfx0(1680);
                }
                return true;
        }
        return false;
}

This will stop people using teletabs to teleport out of areas they shouldnt be teleporting out of.
Now for your other issue you just need to fix

   public boolean inFightCaves()
    {
        return absX >= 2360 && absX <= 2445 && absY >= 5045 && absY <= 5125;
    }

Now I don’t really remember the x/y plane layout for rs off the top of my head but I THINK it should look like this.

   public boolean inFightCaves()
    {
        return absX >= 2360 && absX <= 5045 && absY >= 2445 && absY <= 5125;
    }

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Anieli, post:17, topic:410147”]ok what I was trying to make it do is if you are in the area you cannot teleport, like for example the fight cave once inside you cant teleport out using the spell book. Not making it so you cant teleport into the mini game atall :S[/quote]Sounds like your coords for inFightCaves() are backwards. Also in your teleTabTeleport method you need to add return false; underneath all the c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport”); messages like I said eariler.

item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

I said this before… Go to

Under it add

if(c.inGameTest()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of gametesting"); return; }

Do this same for

If you get no errors tele to

Then try to tele. If it works then well done. It it works, and it’s not the the place you wanted then. Change
the co-ordinates in this boolean below in the player class
public boolean inGameTest() { return absX >= 2737 && absX <= 4882 && absY >= 2707 && absY <= 4915; }

Now remember when doing co-ordinates it’s

absX >= 2737 means the lowest X Coordinate as indicated by the >
absX <= 4882 means the Highest X Coordinate as indicated by the <
absY >= 2707 means the lowest Y Coordinate as indicated by the >
absY <= 4915 means the Highest Y Coordinate as indicated by the <

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

ok

Player.java

[code] public boolean inFightCaves()
{
return absX >= 2360 && absX <= 2445 && absY >= 5045 && absY <= 5125;
}
public boolean inGameTest()
{
return absX >= 2707 && absX <= 2737 && absY >= 4915 && absY <= 4882;
}
public boolean inRFD()
{
return absX >= 1885 && absX <= 1913 && absY >= 5340 && absY <= 5369;
}

public boolean inWarriorG()
{
    return absX >= 2835 && absX <= 2877 && absY >= 3532 && absY <= 3559;
}

public boolean inPirateHouse() {
	return absX >= 3038 && absX <= 3044 && absY >= 3949 && absY <= 3959;
}[/code]

And PlayerAssistant.java

[code] public void startTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType) {
if(c.duelStatus == 5) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport during a duel!”);
return;
}
if(c.inPits || c.viewingOrb || inPitsWait()) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport in here!”);
return;
}
if(c.inGWD()) {
ResetGWKC();
}
if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of prison idiot!”);
return;
}
if(c.Jail == true) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of prison idiot!”);
return;
}
if(c.inGameTest() == true) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of this minigame!”);
return;
}
if(c.inWarriorG() && c.heightLevel == 2) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of Warrior Guild!”);
return;
}
if(c.inRFD()) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of this minigame!”);
return;
}
if(c.inFightCaves()) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of this minigame!”);
return;
}
if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport above level “+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+” in the wilderness.”);
return;
}
if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength) {
c.sendMessage(“You are teleblocked and can’t teleport.”);
return;
}
if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6) {
if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0)
c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
c.stopMovement();
EarningPotential.checkTeleport©;
removeAllWindows();
c.teleX = x;
c.teleY = y;
c.npcIndex = 0;
c.playerIndex = 0;
c.faceUpdate(0);
c.teleHeight = height;
if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase(“modern”)) {
c.startAnimation(8939);
c.teleTimer = 9;
c.gfx0(1576);
c.teleEndAnimation = 8941;
}

		if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("ancient")) {
			c.startAnimation(1979);
			c.teleGfx = 0;
			c.teleTimer = 11;
			c.teleEndAnimation = 0;
			c.gfx0(1681);
		}
		
	}
}[/code]

and

public boolean teleTabTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType){ if(c.Jail == true){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.duelStatus == 5){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport during a duel!"); } else if(c.inFightCaves()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!"); } else if(c.inGameTest()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame."); } else if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport above level "+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+" in the wilderness."); } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength){ c.sendMessage("You are teleblocked and can't teleport."); } else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){ if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0) c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack(); c.stopMovement(); removeAllWindows(); c.teleX = x; c.teleY = y; c.npcIndex = 0; c.playerIndex = 0; c.faceUpdate(0); c.teleHeight = height; if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("teleTab")) { c.startAnimation(9597); c.teleEndAnimation = 11973; c.teleTimer = 8; c.gfx0(1680); } return true; } return false; }

item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

ok I tried that and it compiled fine but still lets you teleport :S

I also tried making it

if(c.inGameTest() == true) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t teleport out of this minigame!”);
return;
}

again compiled fine but made no difference :S

I found this aswell in the jail code.

	if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) {
		c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of prison idiot!");
		return;
	}
	if(c.Jail == true) {
		c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of prison idiot!");
		return;
	}

The first part of this works well so if you are jailed you cant teleport but the second half appears to do nothing? if you tele into the jail then you can just tele out again.

item.title: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
item.dc:creator: @Anieli Anieli
item.description:
@Anieli wrote:

Ok so I wanted to create a new minigame and I don’t want people who play it to be able to teleport out of it. So I had a look at the code for fightpits to use as a guide but I can’t seem to make it work.

I have the following code added under the fightpits code (I will show the fightpits code as well). In case it helps its the HyBriD PvP source.

Player.Java

public boolean inFightCaves() { return absX >= 2360 && absX <= 2445 && absY >= 5045 && absY <= 5125; } public boolean inGameTest() { return absX >= 2737 && absX <= 4882 && absY >= 2707 && absY <= 4915; }

PlayerAssistant.Java

} else if(c.inFightCaves()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!"); } else if(c.inGameTest()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of here. Leave by clicking the ladder at the start.");

It compiles with no errors. Yet when I go to the area and click home tele off I go to home :S

Read full topic
item.source: (PI) Blocking teleports from within an area
